page.title: 12Day In Life Of Farmer's Wife
page.content: Mr and Mrs Harrison run a pig unit. A normal day would be thus: 7.30am. pigs are fed.Children up and dressed,given breakfast.Once a fortnight,weaners are sold for fattening.After feeding,all weaners to be sold are taken out of the large weaner pen and penned up outside ready for loading.The lorry arrives around 8.30 am.Weaners are loaded and the three boys go to school. 9.00am.Our breakfast time. 9.30 am.All sows with pigs(usually about 32)are cleaned out and given fresh straw.Sows are moved out into yards.Pigs into large weaner pen(average 45 to a pen).Pen and boards washed and disinfected for next batch of sows. 11 am.Coffee time,carry on with pen until lunch.
